name: build/api/HttpAPI.js
HttpAPI
description: Common class to access to a geOps api using http.

name: fetch
description: Append the apiKey before sending the request.

name: build/api/MocoAPI.js
MocoAPI
description: This class provides convenience methods to use to the [geOps MOCO API](https://geops.com/de/solution/disruption-information).

name: constructor
description: Constructor

params.name: options.ssoConfig
params.description: SSO config to get notifications from.

name: getNotifications
description:
Get notifications from the MOCO API.
Notifications are returned as an array of GeoJSON feature collections.

return.description: An array of GeoJSON feature collections with coordinates in [EPSG:4326](http://epsg.io/4326).

name: build/api/RealtimeAPI.js
RealtimeMode
description: Enum for Realtime modes.

unknown.tagValue: {RealtimeMode}

name: RealtimeAPI
description: This class provides convenience methods to use to the [geOps Realtime API](https://developer.geops.io/apis/realtime/).

name: bbox
constructor
description: Constructor

params.name: options.bbox
params.description: The bounding box to receive data from.

name: pingIntervalMs
description:
Interval between PING request in ms.
If equal to 0,  no PING request are sent.

name: reconnectTimeoutMs
description: Timeout in ms after an automatic reconnection when the websoscket has been closed by the server.

name: wsApi
description: The websocket helper class to connect the websocket.

name: close
description: Close the websocket connection without reconnection.

name: get
description: Send GET to a channel.

params.name: channelOrParams
params.description: Name of the websocket channel to send GET or an object representing parameters to send

name: getFullTrajectory
description: Get a full trajectory of a vehicule .

params.name: generalizationLevel
params.description: The generalization level to request. Can be one of 5 (more generalized), 10, 30, 100, undefined (less generalized).

name: getStation
description: Return a station with a given uic number and a mode.

name: getStations
description: Get the list of ststions available for a specifc mode. The promise is resolved every 100ms

params.name: timeout
params.description: = 100 Duration in ms between each promise resolve calls.

name: getStopSequence
description: Get the list of stops for this vehicle.

name: getTrajectory
description: Return a partial trajectory with a given id and a mode.

name: onClose
description:
Callback when the websocket is closed by the server.
It auto reconnects after a timeout.

name: onOpen
description:
Callback when the websocket is opened and ready.
It applies the bbox and the projection.

name: open
description: Open the websocket connection.

name: reset
description: Unsubscribe trajectory and deleted_vehicles channels. To resubscribe you have to set a new BBOX.

name: subscribe
description: Subscribe to a channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: Name of the websocket channel to subscribe.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeDeletedVehicles
description: Subscribe to deleted_vhicles channel.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeDepartures
description: Subscribe to departures channel of a given station.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeDisruptions
description: Subscribe to the disruptions channel for tenant.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeExtraGeoms
description: Subscribe to extra_geoms channel.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeFullTrajectory
description: Subscribe to full_trajectory channel of a given vehicle.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeHealthCheck
description: Subscribe to healthcheck channel.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback when the subscribe to healthcheck channel succeeds.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeNewsticker
description: Subscribe to the newsticker channel for tenant.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeStations
description:
Subscribe to stations channel.
One message pro station.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeStopSequence
description: Subscribe to stopsequence channel of a given vehicle.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeTimetable
description: Subscribe to timetable channel of a given station.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: subscribeTrajectory
description: Subscribe to trajectory channel.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Function called on each message of the channel.

params.name: quiet
params.description: If true avoid to store the subscription in the subscriptions list.

name: unsubscribe
description: Unsubscribe both modes of a channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: Name of the websocket channel to unsubscribe.

params.name: suffix
params.description: Suffix to add to the channel name.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

name: unsubscribeDeletedVehicles
description: Unsubscribe to deleted_vhicles channels.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

name: unsubscribeDepartures
description: Unsubscribe from current departures channel.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

name: unsubscribeFullTrajectory

params.name: onMessage

name: unsubscribeHealthCheck

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

name: unsubscribeNewsticker

params.name: onMessage
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

name: unsubscribeStations

name: build/api/WebSocketAPI.js
WebSocketAPI
description:
Class used to facilitate connection to a WebSocketAPI and
also to manage properly messages send to the WebSocketAPI.
This class must not contain any specific implementation.

name: getRequestString
description: Get the websocket request string.

name: close
description: Close the websocket definitively.

name: connect
description: (Re)connect the websocket.

params.name: onOpen
params.description: Callback called when the websocket connection is opened and before subscriptions of previous subscriptions.

name: get
description:
Sends a get request to the websocket.
The callback is called only once, when the response is received or when the call returns an error.

params.name: params
params.description: Parameters for the websocket get request

params.name: errorCb
params.description: Callback on error and close event

name: listen
description: Listen to websocket messages.

params.name: params
params.description: Parameters for the websocket get request

return.description: Object with onMessage and error callbacks

name: send
description: Sends a message to the websocket.

name: subscribe
description: Subscribe to a given channel.

params.name: params
params.description: Parameters for the websocket get request

params.name: quiet
params.description: if false, no GET or SUB requests are send, only the callback is registered.

name: subscribePreviousSubscriptions
description: After an auto reconnection we need to re-subscribe to the channels.

name: unlisten
description: Unlisten websocket messages.

params.name: params
params.description: Parameters for the websocket get request.

name: unsubscribe
description: Unsubscribe from a channel.

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback function to unsubscribe. If null all subscriptions for the channel will be unsubscribed.

name: build/common/controls/StopFinderControlCommon.js

A class representing a stop finder control to display on map.
This class only draw the html elements.
The geographic logic must be implemented by subclasses.

params.description: HTML element where to attach input and suggestions.

params.name: options.apiKey
params.description: Access key for [geOps services](https://developer.geops.io/). See StopsAPI.

name: clear
description: Clear the search field and close the control.

name: search
description: Launch a search.

params.name: abortController
params.description: Abort controller used to cancel the request.

return.description: An array of GeoJSON features with coordinates in [EPSG:4326](http://epsg.io/4326).

name: build/common/styles/realtimeSimpleStyle.js
build/common/typedefs.js
content:
/**
 * @typedef {function} FilterFunction
 * @param {Vehicle} vehicle Vehicle to filter.
 * @returns boolean
 */
/**
 * @typedef {function} SortFunction
 * @param {any} a Object a to compare.
 * @param {any} b Object b to compare.
 * @returns number
 */
/**
 * @typedef {function} getMotsByZoomFunction
 * @param {number} zoom Curent zoom level.
 * @param {RealtimeMot[][]} motsByZoom Default array of mots by zoom.
 * @returns number
 */
/**
 * @typedef {Object} ViewState
 * @property {number|undefined} time A time in ms.
 * @property {number[2]|undefined} center A center in mercator coordinate.
 * @property {number[4]} extent An Extent in mercator coordinates.
 * @property {number[2]} size A size ([width, height]).
 * @property {number} rotation A rotation in radians.
 * @property {number} resolution A resolution.
 * @property {number} zoom A zoom level.
 * @property {number|undefined} pixelRatio A pixel ratio.
 */
/**
 * @typedef {Object} FeatureInfo
 * @property {Layer} layer A layer.
 * @property {Feature[]} features  An array of features.
 * @property {number[2]} coordinate The coordinate where to find the featue.
 */
/**
 * @typedef {Object} VehiclePosition
 * @property {number[2]} coord Coordinate of the vehicle position in Mercator .
 * @property {number!} rotation  An angle in radians representing the direction (from the true north) towards which the vehicle is facing.
 */
// These lines is to block TypeScript to add "use strict;" in the outputed file.
const dummy = () => { };
export default dummy;

unknown.tagValue: boolean
number
number

params.name: motsByZoom
params.description: Default array of mots by zoom.

properties.name: coordinate
properties.description: The coordinate where to find the featue.

properties.name: coord
properties.description: Coordinate of the vehicle position in Mercator .

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: An angle in radians representing the direction (from the true north) towards which the vehicle is facing.

name: build/common/utils/RealtimeEngine.js
RealtimeEngine
description:
This class is responsible for drawing trajectories from a realtime API in a canvas,
depending on the map's view state and at a specific time.

This class is totally agnostic from Maplibre or OpenLayers and must stay taht way.

name: live
description:
If true. The layer will always use Date.now() on the next tick to render the trajectories.
When true, setting the time property has no effect.

name: styleOptions
description: Custom options to pass as last parameter of the style function.

name: addTrajectory
description: Add a trajectory.

name: getRefreshTimeInMs
description: Get the duration before the next update depending on zoom level.

name: getVehicles
description: Get vehicle.

params.name: filterFc
params.description: A function use to filter results.

name: getVehiclesAtCoordinate
description: Request feature information for a given coordinate.

params.name: options
params.description: Options See child classes to see which options are supported.

params.name: options.nb
params.description: The max number of vehicles to return.

return.description: Promise with features, layer and coordinate.

name: onDeleteTrajectoryMessage
description:
Callback on websocket's deleted_vehicles channel events.
It removes the trajectory from the list.

name: onTrajectoryMessage
description:
Callback on websocket's trajectory channel events.
It adds a trajectory to the list.

name: onZoomEnd
description: On zoomend we adjust the time interval of the update of vehicles positions.

name: purgeOutOfDateTrajectories
description: Remove all trajectories that are in the past.

name: purgeTrajectory
description:
Determine if the trajectory is useless and should be removed from the list or not.
By default, this function exclude vehicles:
 - that have their trajectory outside the current extent and
 - that aren't in the MOT list.

return.description: if the trajectory must be displayed or not.

name: renderTrajectories
description:
Render the trajectories requesting an animation frame and cancelling the previous one.
This function must be overrided by children to provide the correct parameters.

params.name: noInterpolate
params.description:
If true trajectories are not interpolated but
  drawn at the last known coordinate. Use this for performance optimization
  during map navigation.

name: renderTrajectoriesInternal
description: Launch renderTrajectories. it avoids duplicating code in renderTrajectories method.

params.name: viewState
params.description: The view state of the map.

params.name: viewState.center
params.description: Center coordinate of the map in mercator coordinate.

params.name: viewState.extent
params.description: Extent of the map in mercator coordinates.

params.name: viewState.size
params.description: Size ([width, height]) of the canvas to render.

params.name: viewState.rotation
params.description: Rotation of the map to render.

params.name: viewState.resolution
params.description: Resolution of the map to render.

params.name: noInterpolate
params.description:
If true trajectories are not interpolated but
  drawn at the last known coordinate. Use this for performance optimization
  during map navigation.

name: startUpdateTime
description: Start the clock.

name: stopUpdateTime
description: Stop the clock.

name: build/common/utils/compareDepartures.js
compareDepartures
description: Compare two given departures for sort alogithm,

name: build/common/utils/constants.js
build/common/utils/createCanvas.js
createCanvas
description:
This function try to create a canvas element and return it.
it uses document.createElement('canvas') if document is available
or new OffscreenCanvas(width, height) if OffscreenCanvas is avalaible (for web worker)
or it returns null if neither is available.

build/common/utils/createDefaultStopFinderElt.js

createRealtimeFilters
description: Return a filter functions based on some parameters of a vehicle.

params.name: line
params.description: A list of vehicle's name to filter. Names can be separated by a comma. Ex: 'S1,S2,S3'

params.name: route
params.description: A list of vehicle's route (contained in route_identifier property) to filter. Indentifiers can be separated by a comma. Ex: 'id1,id2,id3'

params.name: operator
params.description: A list of vehicle's operator to filter. Operators can be separated by a comma. Ex: 'SBB,DB'

params.name: regexLine
params.description: A regex aplly of vehcile's name.

params.name: maxDepartureAge

name: build/common/utils/debounceWebsocketMessages.js
debounceWebsocketMessages
description: This function returns a WebSocket api callback, and call the onUpdate function with the list of of subscribed objects changes.

params.name: onUpdate
params.description: callback when list of subscribed objects changes, called after 100 ms

params.name: getObjectId
params.description: function returning the id of an object

types
description:
Trajserv value: 'Tram',  'Subway / Metro / S-Bahn',  'Train', 'Bus', 'Ferry', 'Cable Car', 'Gondola', 'Funicular', 'Long distance bus', 'Rail',
New endpoint use Rail instead of Train.
New tracker values:  null, "tram", "subway", "rail", "bus", "ferry", "cablecar", "gondola", "funicular", "coach".

name: build/common/utils/sortAndFilterDepartures.js
sortAndfilterDepartures
description:
This function sort Departures by arrival time and filter out unwanted departures:
 - when dparture time is in the past
 - when departure are duplicated
 - when departure is not in the next 30 min

params.name: depObject
params.description: The object containing departures by id.

params.name: sortByMinArrivalTime
params.description: If true sort departures by arrival time.

params.name: maxDepartureAge
params.description: The maximum departure age in minutes.

name: build/maplibre/index.js
build/maplibre/layers/Layer.js
Layer
description: A class representing a layer to display on an Maplibre map.
examples:
import { Layer } from 'mobility-toolbox-js/Maplibre';

const layer = new Layer({ id:'MyLayer' });

name: build/maplibre/layers/RealtimeLayer.js
RealtimeLayer
description: A Maplibre layer able to display data from the [geOps Realtime API](https://developer.geops.io/apis/realtime/).

unknown.tagValue: {function} filter - Filter out a train. This function must be fast, it is executed for every trajectory on every render frame.
{RealtimeMode} mode - The realtime mode to use.
{RealtimeMot[]} mots - Filter trains by its mode of transportation. It filters trains on backend side.
{RealtimeTenant} tenant - Filter trains by its tenant. It filters trains on backend side.
{function} sort - Sort trains. This function must be fast, it is executed on every render frame.

{function} style - Function to style the vehicles.
s

name: constructor
description: Constructor.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: Filter out a train. This function must be fast, it is executed for every trajectory on every render frame.

params.name: options.getMotsByZoom
params.description: Returns for each zoom level the list of MOTs to display. It filters trains on backend side.

params.name: options.minZoomInterpolation
params.description: Minimal zoom level where to start to interpolate train positions.

params.name: options.sort
params.description: Sort trains. This function must be fast, it is executed on every render frame.

params.name: options.tenant
params.description: Filter trains by its tenant. It filters trains on backend side.

name: getViewState
description: Return the current view state. Used by the RealtimeEngine.

name: onAdd
description: Add sources, layers and listeners to the map.

name: onMove
description: Callback on 'move' event.

name: onMoveEnd
description: Callback on 'moveend' event.

name: onRealtimeEngineRender
description: Callback when the RealtimeEngine has rendered successfully.

name: onRemove
description: Remove source, layers and listeners from the map.

name: start
description: Start updating vehicles position.

name: stop
description: Stop updating vehicles position.

name: build/maplibre/layers/index.js
content:
export { default as Layer } from './Layer';
export { default as RealtimeLayer } from './RealtimeLayer';

CopyrightControl

params.name: format
params.description: Function used to format the list of copyrights available to a single string. By default join all the copyrights with a |.

name: build/ol/controls/RoutingControl.js
RoutingControl
description:
This OpenLayers control allows the user to add and modifiy via points to
a map and request a route from the [geOps Routing API](https://developer.geops.io/apis/routing/).

unknown.tagValue: {string} mot - Mean of transport to be used for routing.
{VectorLayer} routingLayer - Layer for adding route features.
{boolean} loading - True if the control is requesting the backend.

name: constructor
description: Constructor.

params.name: options.graphs
params.description: Array of routing graphs and min/max zoom levels. If you use the control in combination with the [geOps Maps API](https://developer.geops.io/apis/maps/), you may want to use the optimal level of generalizations: "[['gen4', 0, 8], ['gen3', 8, 9], ['gen2', 9, 11], ['gen1', 11, 13], ['osm', 13, 99]]".

params.name: options.mot
params.description: Mean of transport to be used for routing.

params.name: options.routingLayer
params.description: Vector layer for adding route features.

params.name: options.snapToClosestStation
params.description: If true, the routing will snap the coordinate to the closest station. Default to false.

params.name: options.style
params.description: Style of the default vector layer.

params.name: options.useRawViaPoints
params.description: Experimental property. If true, it allows the user to add via points using different kind of string. See "via" parameter defined by the [geOps Routing API](https://developer.geops.io/apis/routing/). Default to false, only array of coordinates and station's id are supported as via points.

name: getGraphsResolutions
description: Calculate at which resolutions corresponds each generalizations.

name: abortRequests
description: Aborts viapoint and route requests

name: addListeners
description: Add click listener to map.

name: addViaPoint
description:
Adds/Replaces a viaPoint to the viaPoints array and redraws route:
  Adds a viaPoint at end of array by default.
  If an index is passed a viaPoint is added at the specified index.
  If an index is passed and overwrite x is > 0, x viaPoints at the specified
    index are replaced with a single new viaPoint.

params.name: coordinatesOrString
params.description: Array of coordinates or a string representing a station

params.name: index
params.description: Integer representing the index of the added viaPoint. If not specified, the viaPoint is added at the end of the array.

params.name: overwrite
params.description: Marks the number of viaPoints that are removed at the specified index on add.

name: createDefaultElement
description: Define a default element.

name: createModifyInteraction
description: Create the interaction used to modify vertexes of features.

name: drawRoute
description:
Draws route on map using an array of coordinates:
  If a single coordinate is passed a single point feature is added to map.
  If two or more coordinates are passed a request to the RoutingAPI fetches
      the route using the passed coordinates and the current mot.

name: drawViaPoint
description: Draw a via point. This function can parse all the possibilitiies

name: onActiveChange
description: Activet7deactivate the control when activ eproperty changes

name: onMapClick
description:
Used on click on map while control is active:
  By default adds a viaPoint to the end of array.
  If an existing viaPoint is clicked removes the clicked viaPoint.

name: onModifyEnd
description:
Used on end of the modify interaction. Resolves feature modification:
  Line drag creates new viaPoint at the final coordinate of drag.
  Point drag replaces old viaPoint.

name: onModifyStart
description:
Used on start of the modify interaction. Stores relevant data
in this.initialRouteDrag object

name: removeListeners
description: Remove click listener from map.

name: removeViaPoint
description:
Removes a viaPoint at the passed array index and redraws route
By default the last viaPoint is removed.

params.name: index
params.description: Integer representing the index of the viaPoint to delete.

name: reset
description: Removes all viaPoints, clears the source and triggers a change event

name: setViaPoints
description: Replaces the current viaPoints with a new coordinate array.

name: build/ol/utils/getFeatureInfoAtCoordinate.js
getFeatureInfoAtCoordinate
description:
Fetches feature information at a given coordinate from the provided layers.
It supports WMS sources and MapLibre layers and custom layer via the method `layer.getFeatureInfoAtCoordinate`.

unknown.tagValue: {LayerGetFeatureInfoResponse[]} A promise that resolves to an array of feature information responses.

params.name: coordinate
params.description: The coordinate to query for feature information.

params.name: layers
params.description: The layers to query for feature information.

params.name: hitTolerance
params.description: The pixel tolerance for feature selection.

params.name: ignoreLayerMethod
params.description: If true, it ignores the `getFeatureInfoAtCoordinate` method on layers.

return.description: A promise that resolves to an array of feature information responses.

name: build/ol/utils/index.js
content: export { default as getFeatureInfoAtCoordinate } from './getFeatureInfoAtCoordinate';

# mobility-toolbox-js

Toolbox for JavaScript applications in the domains of mobility and logistics.
The tools in this library have been inspired by many projects realized for public transport agencies, mobility providers and logistics companies.

[![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/mobility-toolbox-js.svg?style=flat-square)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mobility-toolbox-js)
[![Build](https://github.com/geops/mobility-toolbox-js/actions/workflows/build.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/geops/mobility-toolbox-js/actions/workflows/build.yml)
[![Lint / Unit tests](https://github.com/geops/mobility-toolbox-js/actions/workflows/test.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/geops/mobility-toolbox-js/actions/workflows/test.yml)
![Vercel](https://vercelbadge.vercel.app/api/geops/mobility-toolbox-js)

## Documentation and examples

Visit https://mobility-toolbox-js.geops.io/

## Demos

* Display [real-time vehicle positions and prognosis data](https://mobility.portal.geops.io) on a map.
* Search for [stops and stations](https://maps.trafimage.ch) all over the world.
* Get [precise geographic courses](https://routing-demo.geops.io/) for all modes of transport.
* Generate beautiful [schematic](https://mobility.portal.geops.io/world.geops.networkplans) or [topographic](https://mobility.portal.geops.io) maps for public transport, mobility and logistics.

## Install

Install the library and the peer dependencies:

```bash
yarn add ol maplibre-gl mobility-toolbox-js
```

## Development

```bash
yarn install
yarn dev
```

`yarn dev` starts a vite server using the `index.html` file at the root of the project.
This html file loads the `dev.js` file. Use this file to develop the library.
Each time you modifiy the library code you have to run `yarn build:tsc` to see the changes.

## Development documentation

The documentations website is located in the `doc/`  folder.
It's a nextJS website that use the mobility-toolbox-js library built from the `build/` folder.

## Deploy

This library website is deployed automatically using [Vercel](https://vercel.com/geops).
For Vercel we have to add the nextjs and raw-loader modules in the dev dependencies of the main package.json.
But those 2 librairies are not needed to build the library.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "mobility-toolbox-js",
  "license": "MIT",
  "description": "Toolbox for JavaScript applications in the domains of mobility and logistics.",
  "version": "3.3.1",
  "homepage": "https://mobility-toolbox-js.geops.io/",
  "exports": {
    ".": "./index.js",
    "./api": "./api/index.js",
    "./maplibre": "./maplibre/index.js",
    "./ol": "./ol/index.js",
    "./types": "./types/index.d.ts"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@geoblocks/ol-maplibre-layer": "^1.0.3",
    "@turf/helpers": "7.2.0",
    "@turf/transform-rotate": "7.2.0",
    "lodash.debounce": "4.0.8",
    "lodash.throttle": "4.1.1",
    "uuid": "11.1.0"
  },
  "peerDependencies": {
    "maplibre-gl": ">=4",
    "ol": ">=9"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.28.0",
    "@babel/preset-typescript": "^7.27.1",
    "@commitlint/cli": "19.8.1",
    "@commitlint/config-conventional": "19.8.1",
    "@geops/eslint-config-react": "1.5.0",
    "@types/geojson": "7946.0.16",
    "@types/lodash": "^4.17.20",
    "@types/lodash.debounce": "4.0.9",
    "@types/lodash.throttle": "4.1.9",
    "@types/mapbox-gl": "3.4.1",
    "@types/offscreencanvas": "2019.7.3",
    "@types/topojson": "3.2.6",
    "@types/uuid": "10.0.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "8.38.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "8.38.0",
    "cypress": "14.5.2",
    "esbuild": "0.25.8",
    "esdoc": "1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "1.0.0",
    "esdoc-publish-html-plugin": "1.1.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.0.0",
    "esdoc-typescript-plugin": "1.0.1",
    "eslint": "9.31.0",
    "fixpack": "4.0.0",
    "husky": "9.1.7",
    "is-ci": "4.1.0",
    "jest": "30.0.5",
    "jest-canvas-mock": "2.5.2",
    "jest-environment-jsdom": "30.0.5",
    "jest-fetch-mock": "3.0.3",
    "jest-serializer-html": "7.1.0",
    "jest-transformer-svg": "2.1.0",
    "jest-websocket-mock": "2.5.0",
    "lint-staged": "16.1.2",
    "maplibre-gl": "5.6.1",
    "mock-socket": "9.3.1",
    "next": "15.4.3",
    "next-transpile-modules": "10.0.1",
    "ol": "10.6.1",
    "openapi-typescript": "7.8.0",
    "prettier": "3.6.2",
    "raw-loader": "4.0.2",
    "sort-json": "2.0.1",
    "standard-version": "9.5.0",
    "start-server-and-test": "2.0.12",
    "stylelint": "16.22.0",
    "stylelint-config-recommended-scss": "15.0.1",
    "stylelint-config-standard": "38.0.0",
    "stylelint-scss": "6.12.1",
    "ts-jest": "^29.4.0",
    "typescript": "5.8.3",
    "vite": "^7.0.5"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "apidoc": "esdoc && cp apidoc/index.json doc/src/components/Esdoc",
    "build": "yarn build:tsc && yarn esbuild:iife",
    "build:tsc": "rm -rf build && yarn tsc && cp package.json build/ && cp README.md build/ && cp LICENSE build/  && cp -R src/types build/ && find build -type f -name '*.test.*' -delete",
    "clean": "rm -rf .next && rm -rf doc/.next",
    "coverage": "yarn test  --watchAll=false  --coverage --coverageDirectory=coverage",
    "cy:open": "cypress open",
    "cy:test": "start-server-and-test dev http://localhost:3000 'cypress run --browser chrome'",
    "cy:test:chrome": "yarn build && start-server-and-test start http://localhost:3000 'cypress run --browser chrome'",
    "cy:test:edge": "yarn build && start-server-and-test start http://localhost:3000 'cypress run --browser edge'",
    "cy:test:firefox": "yarn build && start-server-and-test start http://localhost:3000 'cypress run --browser firefox'",
    "dev": "vite",
    "doc": "yarn build && yarn apidoc && cd doc && rm -rf node_modules/mobility-toolbox-js && yarn install --force && yarn build",
    "doc:dev": "yarn clean && yarn build && yarn apidoc && yarn doc:dev:examples",
    "doc:dev:examples": "yarn clean && yarn build && cd doc && rm -rf node_modules/mobility-toolbox-js && yarn install --force && yarn dev",
    "esbuild": "yarn esbuild:all && yarn esbuild:iife",
    "esbuild:all": "esbuild src/index.js src/**/*.js src/**/*.ts src/**/**/*.js src/**/**/*.ts --target=chrome100 --outdir=build/ --loader:.js=jsx",
    "esbuild:iife": "yarn esbuild:iife:unminify && yarn esbuild:iife:minify",
    "esbuild:iife:base": "esbuild src/iife.js --bundle --sourcemap --target=chrome100",
    "esbuild:iife:minify": "yarn esbuild:iife:base --minify --outfile=build/mbt.min.js",
    "esbuild:iife:unminify": "yarn esbuild:iife:base --outfile=build/mbt.js",
    "format": "prettier --write 'src/**/*.js' 'src/**/*.ts'  'src/**/*.test.js' && eslint src/**/*.js src/**/*.test.js src/**/*.ts --fix && stylelint 'src/**/*.css' 'src/**/*.scss' --fix --allow-empty-input",
    "lint": "eslint src/**/*.js src/**/*.ts && stylelint src/**/*.css src/**/*.scss --allow-empty-input",
    "prepare": "is-ci || husky",
    "publish:beta": "HUSKY=0 yarn release -- --prerelease beta --skip.changelog  && yarn run build && cd build && HUSKY=0 yarn publish --tag beta && git push origin HEAD && git push --tags ",
    "publish:beta:dryrun": "yarn release -- --prerelease beta --dry-run --skip.changelog",
    "publish:public": "yarn release  && yarn run build && cd build && HUSKY=0 yarn publish && git push origin HEAD && git push --tags ",
    "publish:public:dryrun": "yarn release --dry-run",
    "release": "standard-version",
    "start": "yarn doc && cd doc && yarn start",
    "start:examples": "cd doc && yarn build && yarn start",
    "test": "TZ='UTC' jest ",
    "test:watch": "yarn test --watchAll",
    "tsc": "tsc",
    "types:backend": " yarn types:stops && yarn types:routing && yarn types:moco",
    "types:moco": "openapi-typescript https://moco.dev.geops.io/api/v1/swagger/?format=openapi --output src/types/moco.d.ts",
    "types:routing": "openapi-typescript https://developer.geops.io/swagger/routing.json --output src/types/routing.d.ts",
    "types:stops": "openapi-typescript  https://developer.geops.io/swagger/stops.json --output src/types/stops.d.ts",
    "up": "yarn upgrade-interactive --latest"
  },
  "browserslist": [
    ">0.2%",
    "not dead",
    "not op_mini all",
    "not ie <= 11",
    "not android < 5"
  ],
  "keywords": [
    "mobility",
    "realtime",
    "routing",
    "stops",
    "toolbox"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/geops/mobility-toolbox-js"
  },
  "sideEffects": false
}
name: package.json
filter
description: Filter out a train. This function must be fast, it is executed for every trajectory on every render frame.

name: mode
description: The realtime mode to use.

name: mots
description: Filter trains by its mode of transportation. It filters trains on backend side.

name: tenant
description: Filter trains by its tenant. It filters trains on backend side.

name: sort
description: Sort trains. This function must be fast, it is executed on every render frame.

name: style
description: Function to style the vehicles.

name: mot
description: Mean of transport to be used for routing.

name: routingLayer
description: Layer for adding route features.

name: loading
description: True if the control is requesting the backend.

name: mapLibreMap
description: The Maplibre map object. Readonly.

name: style
description: The [geOps Maps API](https://developer.geops.io/apis/maps) style.

name: allowRenderWhenAnimating
description: Allow rendering of the layer when the map is animating.
